Math functions used internally.

Function Documentation

void gtrack_calcDim ( float *  mSpread,
float  R,
float *  tDim 
)

Description
This function computes target dimension estimations based on estimated measurement spread and centroid range Matrix is real, single precision floating point. Matrix is in row-major order

Parameters
[in]mSpreadVector S
[in]Rscalar Range
[out]tDim
Return values
None
void gtrack_matrixAdd ( uint16_t  rows,
uint16_t  cols,
float *  A,
float *  B,
float *  C 
)

Description
This function is used to add two matrices. Matrices are all real, single precision floating point. Matrices are in row-major order

Parameters
[in]rowsNumber of rows
[in]colsNumber of cols
[in]AMatrix A
[in]BMatrix B
[out]CMatrix C(rows,cols) = A(rows,cols) + B(rows,cols)
Return values
None
void gtrack_matrixCholesky ( uint16_t  dim,
const float *  A,
float *  G 
)

Description
This function performs cholesky decomposition of square matrix. Matrix are squared, real, single precision floating point. Matrix are in row-major order

Parameters
[in]dim(dim=rows=cols) Number of rows and cols
[in]AMatrix A
[out]GMatrix G = cholseky(A);
Return values
None
void gtrack_matrixComputePJT ( float *  P,
float *  J,
float *  PJ 
)

Description
This function is used to multiply two matrices. First matrix P is of size 9x9, the second one is of the size 4x9. The second matrix is being transposed first. Matrices are all real, single precision floating point. Matrices are in row-major order

Parameters
[in]PMatrix P
[in]JMatrix J
[out]PJMatrix PJ = P(9,9) X J(4,9)T
Return values
None
void gtrack_matrixCovAcc ( uint16_t  size,
float *  A,
float *  v,
float *  mean 
)

Description
This function accumulates covariance matrix with variances from input vector and mean Matrices are all real, single precision floating point. Vectors are real, single precision floating point.

Parameters
[in]sizeSize of square matrix
[in]AMatrix A
[in]vVector v
[in]meanVector mean
Return values
None
void gtrack_matrixCovFilter ( uint16_t  size,
float *  A,
float *  B,
float  alpha 
)

Description
This function filters covariance matrix Matrices are all real, single precision floating point.

Parameters
[in]sizeSize of square matrix
[in,out]AMatrix A
[in]BMatrix B
[in]alphaFiltering coefficient alpha Matrix A = (1-alpha)*A + alpha*B
Return values
None
void gtrack_matrixCovNormalize ( uint16_t  size,
float *  A,
uint16_t  num 
)

Description
This function normalizes covariance matrix Matrices are all real, single precision floating point.

Parameters
[in]sizeSize of square matrix
[in,out]AMatrix A
[in]numNumber of measurments num
Return values
None

Parameters

[out]AMatrix A(size,size) = eye(size)

void gtrack_matrixGetDiag ( uint16_t  size,
float *  A,
float *  v 
)

Description
This function is used to get diagonal from the square matrix

Parameters
[in]sizeSize of square matrix
[in]AMatrix A(size,size)
[out]vDiagonal vector, v(size) = diag(A(size*size))
Return values
None

uint16_t  cols,
float  value,
float *  A 
)

Description
This function is used to initialise matrix to a value

Parameters
[in]rowsNumber of rows
[in]colsNumber of cols
[in]valuevalue to set
[out]AMatrix A(rows,cols) = ones(rows,cols)*value
Return values
None
void gtrack_matrixMakeSymmetrical ( uint16_t  m,
float *  A,
float *  B 
)

Description
This function is used to force matrix symmetry by averaging off-diagonal elements Matrices are squared, real, single precision floating point. Matrices are in row-major order

Parameters
[in]m(m=rows=cols) Number of rows and cols
[in]AMatrix A
[out]BMatrix B
Return values
None
void gtrack_matrixMultiply ( uint16_t  rows,
uint16_t  m,
uint16_t  cols,
float *  A,
float *  B,
float *  C 
)

Description
This function is used to multiply two matrices. Matrices are all real, single precision floating point. Matrices are in row-major order

Parameters
[in]rowsOuter dimension, number of rows
[in]mInner dimension
[in]colsOuter dimension, number of cols
[in]AMatrix A
[in]BMatrix B
[out]CMatrix C(rows,cols) = A(rows,m) X B(cols,m)T
Return values
None
void gtrack_matrixMultiply66 ( float *  A,
float *  B,
float *  C 
)

Description
This function is used to multiply two matrices of the size 9x9. Matrices are all real, single precision floating point. Matrices are in row-major order

Parameters
[in]AMatrix A
[in]BMatrix B
[out]CMatrix C(9x9) = A(9x9) X B(9x9)
Return values
None
void gtrack_matrixMultiply66T ( float *  A,
float *  B,
float *  C 
)

Description
This function is used to multiply two matrices of size 9x9. Second Matrix is getting transposed first Matrices are all real, single precision floating point. Matrices are in row-major order

Parameters
[in]AMatrix A
[in]BMatrix B
[out]CMatrix C(9x9) = A(9x9) X B(9x9)T
Return values
None

void gtrack_matrixScalarMultiply ( uint16_t  rows,
uint16_t  cols,
float *  A,
float  c,
float *  B 
)

Description
This function is used to multiply matrix by a scalar. Matrices are all real, single precision floating point. Matrices are in row-major order

Parameters
[in]rowsNumber of rows
[in]colsNumber of cols
[in]AMatrix A
[in]cScalar c
[out]BMatrix B(rows,cols) = A(rows,cols) * c
Return values
None

float *  v,
float *  A 
)

Description
This function is used to create diagonal square matrix

Parameters
[in]sizeSize of square matrix
[in]vDiagonal vector
[out]AMatrix A(size,size) = diag(v(size))
Return values
None
void gtrack_matrixSub ( uint16_t  rows,
uint16_t  cols,
float *  A,
float *  B,
float *  C 
)

Description
This function is used to subtract two matrices. Matrices are all real, single precision floating point. Matrices are in row-major order

Parameters
[in]rowsNumber of rows
[in]colsNumber of cols
[in]AMatrix A
[in]BMatrix B
[out]CMatrix C(rows,cols) = A(rows,cols) - B(rows,cols)
Return values
None
void gtrack_matrixTransposeMultiply ( uint16_t  rows,
uint16_t  m,
uint16_t  cols,
float *  A,
float *  B,
float *  C 
)

Description
This function is used to multiply two matrices. Second Matrix is getting transposed first Matrices are all real, single precision floating point. Matrices are in row-major order

Parameters
[in]rowsOuter dimension, number of rows
[in]mInner dimension
[in]colsOuter dimension, number of cols
[in]AMatrix A
[in]BMatrix B
[out]CMatrix C(rows,cols) = A(rows,m) X B(cols,m)T
Return values
None

float *  pSinVal,
float *  pCosVal 
)

Description
This function is used to compute sine and cosine of the angle in degrees

Parameters
[in]thetaAngle, in degrees Matrix B
[out]pSinValpointer to computed sine value, degrees
[out]pCosValpointer to computed sine value, degrees
Return values
None
void gtrack_vectorAdd ( uint16_t  size,
float *  A,
float *  B,
float *  C 
)

Description
This function adds two vectors Vectors are real, single precision floating point.

Parameters
[in]sizeSize of vector
[in]AVector A
[in]BVector B
[out]CVector C = A + B;
Return values
None
void gtrack_vectorFilter ( uint16_t  size,
float *  A,
float  alpha,
float *  B 
)

Description
This function performs IIR vector filtering Vectors are real, single precision floating point. Alpha is real, single precision floating point.

Parameters
[in]sizeSize of vector
[in,out]AVector A
[in]alphaWeighting factor for new information, (0<=alpha<=1.0f)
[in]BNew information vector B

Vector A = A*(1.0f-alpha) + B*alpha;

Return values
None
void gtrack_vectorInit ( uint16_t  size,
float  value,
float *  A 
)

Description
This function is used to initialise vector to a value

Parameters
[in]sizeSize of vector
[in]valuevalue to set
[out]AVector A

A(size) = ones(size,1)*value

Return values
None
void gtrack_vectorScalarMul ( uint16_t  size,
float *  A,
float  c,
float *  B 
)

Description
This function multiplies vector by scalar Vectors are real, single precision floating point. Scalar is real, single precision floating point.

Parameters
[in]sizeSize of vector
[in]AVector A
[in]cScalar c
[out]BVector B = A*c;
Return values
None
void gtrack_vectorScalarMulAcc ( uint16_t  size,
float *  A,
float  c,
float *  B 
)

Description
This function performs multiplies vector by scalar and accumulates the results Vectors are real, single precision floating point. Scalar is real, single precision floating point.

Parameters
[in]sizeSize of vector
[in]AVector A
[in]cScalar c
[in,out]BVector B = B + A*c;
Return values
None
void gtrack_vectorSub ( uint16_t  size,
float *  A,
float *  B,
float *  C 
)

Description
This function subtracts two vectors Vectors are real, single precision floating point.

Parameters
[in]sizeSize of vectors
[in]AVector A
[in]BVector B
[out]CVector C = A - B;
Return values
None
